verses.kjv: Would to God ye could bear with me a little in my folly: and indeed bear with me.
verses.ct: I wish you would put up with a little foolishness from me — and please do put up with me.

verses.kjv: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
verses.ct: I have a deep, God-given jealousy for you, because I promised you to one husband, so that I could present you to Christ as a pure and faithful bride.

verses.kjv: But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.
verses.ct: But I'm worried that just as the serpent deceived Eve with his cunning, your minds might be led astray from your sincere and pure devotion to Christ.

verses.kjv: For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or if ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with him.
verses.ct: Because if someone comes along and preaches a different Jesus than the one we preached, or offers you a different spirit than the one you received, or a different gospel than the one you accepted, you seem perfectly willing to put up with that.

verses.kjv: For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.
verses.ct: I don't consider myself inferior in any way to those so-called "super-apostles."

verses.kjv: But though I be rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been throughly made manifest among you in all things.
verses.ct: I may not be a polished speaker, but I certainly have knowledge. We've made that completely clear to you in every possible way.

verses.kjv: Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?
verses.ct: Did I do something wrong by humbling myself so that you could be lifted up, by preaching God's good news to you free of charge?

verses.kjv: I robbed other churches, taking wages of them, to do you service.
verses.ct: I took financial support from other churches — essentially taking their resources — so that I could serve you.

verses.kjv: And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all things I have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, and so will I keep myself.
verses.ct: When I was with you and ran short of money, I didn't burden any of you. The brothers who came from Macedonia provided what I needed. I've made it a point never to be a financial burden to you, and I'll keep it that way.

verses.kjv: As the truth of Christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
verses.ct: As surely as Christ's truth lives in me, no one in all of Achaia will take this reason for pride away from me.

verses.kjv: Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.
verses.ct: Why do I do this? Because I don't love you? God knows that I do.

verses.kjv: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.
verses.ct: But I will keep doing what I'm doing in order to remove any opportunity from those who are looking for a chance to claim that their work is equal to ours.

verses.kjv: For such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.
verses.ct: These people are fake apostles, dishonest workers who disguise themselves as apostles of Christ.

verses.kjv: And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.
verses.ct: That shouldn't surprise anyone — Satan himself disguises himself as an angel of light.

verses.kjv: Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.
verses.ct: So it's no big deal if his servants also disguise themselves as servants of righteousness. In the end, they'll get what their actions deserve.

verses.kjv: I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.
verses.ct: Let me say it again: don't think I'm a fool. But even if you do, then at least accept me as a fool so I can do a little boasting.

verses.kjv: That which I speak, I speak it not after the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.
verses.ct: What I'm about to say isn't something the Lord would say — I'm speaking like a fool in this bold moment of bragging.

verses.kjv: Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.
verses.ct: Since so many people boast about their human credentials, I'll do the same.

verses.kjv: For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye yourselves are wise.
verses.ct: After all, you're so wise that you gladly tolerate fools!

verses.kjv: For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour you, if a man take of you, if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.
verses.ct: You put up with it when someone enslaves you, exploits you, takes advantage of you, acts superior to you, or even slaps you in the face.

verses.kjv: I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.
verses.ct: I'm ashamed to admit that we were apparently too "weak" for that kind of behavior. But whatever anyone else dares to boast about — I'm speaking foolishly here — I can match it.

verses.kjv: Are they Hebrews? so am I. Are they Israelites? so am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? so am I.
verses.ct: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they descendants of Abraham? So am I.

verses.kjv: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.
verses.ct: Are they servants of Christ? I know this sounds crazy, but I'm even more of one. I've worked harder, been whipped far more, spent more time in prison, and faced death again and again.

verses.kjv: Of the Jews five times received I forty stripes save one.
verses.ct: 5 different times the Jewish authorities gave me 39 lashes.

verses.kjv: Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep;
verses.ct: 3 times I was beaten with rods, once I was pelted with stones, 3 times I survived shipwrecks, and once I spent a full night and day adrift in the open sea.

verses.kjv: In journeyings often, in perils of waters, in perils of robbers, in perils by mine own countrymen, in perils by the heathen, in perils in the city, in perils in the wilderness, in perils in the sea, in perils among false brethren;
verses.ct: I've been constantly on the move, facing danger from rivers, danger from bandits, danger from my own people, danger from Gentiles, danger in cities, danger in the wilderness, danger at sea, and danger from people pretending to be brothers.

verses.kjv: In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.
verses.ct: I've experienced exhaustion and hardship, many sleepless nights, hunger and thirst, going without food many times, and exposure to cold without adequate clothing.

verses.kjv: Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.
verses.ct: On top of all that external pressure, I carry a daily burden — my concern for all the churches.

verses.kjv: Who is weak, and I am not weak? who is offended, and I burn not?
verses.ct: When someone is struggling, I feel that struggle. When someone is led into sin, it burns me up inside.

verses.kjv: If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.
verses.ct: If I have to boast, I'll boast about the things that reveal my weakness.

verses.kjv: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.
verses.ct: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus Christ, who is praised forever, knows that I'm not lying.

verses.kjv: In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:
verses.ct: In Damascus, the governor serving under King Aretas had the city guarded in order to arrest me.

verses.kjv: And through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.
verses.ct: But I was lowered in a basket through a window in the city wall, and I escaped his grasp.
